title: Dynamics & Layers
description: Learn to build drum patterns from sparse to dense, creating energy and dynamics.

steps.title: Building Dynamics
steps.description: Great drumming isn't just about playing the right notes — it's about dynamics. Starting sparse and gradually adding more elements creates excitement and forward motion. Think of it like building a wall: start with the foundation and add bricks one layer at a time.

steps.title: Layer 1: Kick Only
steps.description: Start with just the kick — the sparse foundation. This is the quietest, most minimal beat.

steps.title: Layer 2: Add Hi-Hat
steps.description: Add the closed hi-hat to the kick. Now there's a pulse and a rhythm.

steps.title: Layer 3: Add Snare
steps.description: Add the snare on top. Now you have a full basic beat: kick, hi-hat, and snare.

steps.title: Layer 4: Add Open Hi-Hat
steps.description: Swap in the open hi-hat for more energy. Kick, snare, and open hat.

steps.title: Layer 5: Full Energy
steps.description: Maximum energy: kick, snare, open hi-hat, and crash. This is the climactic moment!
steps.hint: Hit KCK, SNR, OHH, and CRS all at once.

steps.title: Strip Back: Minimal Again
steps.description: After the climax, strip back to just the ride for contrast. Dynamics are about contrast!
steps.hint: Just the RDE pad — quiet and shimmering.
